business.headline: Is the IPO craze over? Stock market correction hits public listingsSubscription figures for IPOs have dropped in recent months. Global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates, and tighter liquidity have made investors cautious.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingNTPC Green Energy is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTPC Ltd, focusing on renewable energy projects through both organic growth and acquisitions.
I don't believe in work-life balance: Narayana MurthyNarayana Murthy said that hard work is key to national progress, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's long work hours as an example.

Rs 1 lakh investment now worth Rs 8 lakh: Check this LIC-backed penny stockATV Projects India has shown remarkable growth over recent years, making it one of the standout multibagger stocks in the Indian market. Since the start of 2024, the stock has risen by over 110%, moving from Rs 15.25 to Rs 32.50 per share.

Stock markets in free fall: Is it a good time to invest in mutual funds?With the Sensex and Nifty tumbling nearly 10% from their peaks, investors are wondering: Could this market correction be a blessing in disguise for mutual fund investors?

Stock markets in correction phase: More turbulence ahead on Dalal Street?The Sensex and Nifty have tumbled nearly 10% from their recent peaks, leaving investors wondering: Is this just a healthy pause, or should they brace for more turbulence?

SBI hikes home loan interest rates by 5 basis points. Check details  The change in interest rates is effective from November 15, and will make borrowing costs slightly higher for customers seeking loans from the State Bank of India (SBI).

Signature Global shares at over Rs 2,000? These 2 brokerages are bullishShares of Signature Global rose nearly 3.5% in the previous trading session after multiple brokerages raised their target price. Its total market capitalisation stands at 18,238.99 crore.
Piyush Goyal wants RBI to cut interest rates. Shaktikanta Das respondsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal described the link between food inflation and interest rates as an 'absolutely flawed theory.'

I'll take this with me to grave: Narayana Murthy defends 6-day workweek viewNarayana Murthy, who has been vocal about his views on work ethics and productivity, expressed disappointment over India's move from a six-day workweek to a five-day one in 1986.

'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Report flags Starlink's US military tiesStarlink operates through a constellation of satellites to provide internet access worldwide, a model distinct from traditional telecom services that rely on ground-based towers.

Stock markets closed today for Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday?Sensex and Nifty, have faced a six-session losing streak, marked by selling pressure from foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and worries over rising retail inflation.
Siemens layoffs: Tech giant may cut up to 5,000 jobs amid ongoing strugglesThe company's Q4 FY 2024 results highlighted the impact of global geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges.

Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight session as FMCG stocks decline sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 110.64 points lower at 77,580.31 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.35 points to 23,532.70.

More trouble for Ola Electric, faces probe over poor service standards: ReportThis comes after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) issued a notice to the SoftBank-backed e-scooter maker following a high volume of complaints.

Boeing layoffs: Aerospace giant to reduce workforce by 17,000Boeing Layoffs: The aerospace giant has faced financial challenges this year, pushing it to make these deep cuts to realign its current financial realities.
Markets in free fall: These sectors and stocks can be safe betsBoth the Sensex and Nifty indices have fallen around 10% from their 52-week peaks, marking a notable slump in the market.

Trump factor, FII selling: Why Sensex, Nifty fell for 6th straight sessionThe benchmark Sensex dropped over 250 points, while the Nifty fell over 100 points during intraday trade, marking a significant 10% decline from their September peaks.

Can you expect major income tax changes in Budget 2025? Check detailsThe Finance Ministry has established 22 specialised sub-committees to examine various aspects of the Income Tax Act, with an aim to simplify tax structures, expand tax base, and balance revenue generation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: BCCI flags Pak board's plan to host Champions Trophy tour in POK: SourcesThe Indian cricket board has raised its concerns with the International Cricket Council over Pakistan's plan to host the Champions Trophy tour in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK). ICC sources have told India Today that it would announce plans for the trophy tour soon.

Exclusive: Fadnavis reacts as Ajit Pawar, Ashok Chavan reject 'batenge to katenge'Asked about the opposition to these slogans from some quarters of the BJP and alliance partners like Ajit Pawar's NCP, Devendra Fadnavis said they come from a different ideology and such statements reflect their "pseudo-secular" background.

UK PM's office apologises after row over non-veg food, alcohol at Diwali receptionPrime Minister Keir Starmer's office issued an apology on Friday for a "mistake" in the organisation of its Diwali reception at 10 Downing Street after receiving criticism for including non-vegetarian food and alcohol at the event.

How war of slogans in Maharashtra, Jharkhand has gone beyond bijli, paniFrom 'bijli, pani, sadak' to 'India Shining' and 'Ab ki Bar Modi Sarkar', slogans defined elections and described the politics of the day. What does the war of slogans ahead of the Maharashtra and Jharkhand Assembly reveal?

How bloody siege of Mecca Grand Mosque 45 years ago split Muslim worldExactly 45 years ago, Mecca Grand Mosque, Islam's holiest place, was taken over by 200 armed men led by preacher Juhayman al-Utaybi. Blood would flow before the weeks-long siege ended. The events of 1979 turned Saudi Arabia into a radical Sunni country, and split the Muslim world, the impact of which is felt to this day.

Dehradun accident: Students partied, raced BMW, decapitated in high-speed crashA newly surfaced video has raised questions about the circumstances leading to a deadly car crash in Dehradun earlier this week that claimed the lives of six college students.

Adani not part of meet to discuss BJP-NCP government in 2019: Devendra FadnavisAfter Sharad Pawar claimed that Gautam Adani hosted a meeting of BJP and NCP leaders at his Delhi residence in 2019, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis clarified that the industrialist was never involved in such meetings.

Row over delay in Rahul Gandhi's chopper take-off, Congress blames BJPRahul Gandhi's helicopter was delayed for nearly two hours in Godda, Jharkhand, due to a lack of ATC clearance, which Congress claimed was politically motivated.

Breathing air in Delhi is like smoking 25 cigarettes a day: Can it cause cancer?Delhi's air quality has reached hazardous levels, with pollution equated to smoking 25 to 30 cigarettes a day, reducing life expectancy and increasing cancer risks.

Amit Shah's chopper checked by poll officials, he shares video and a messagePosting a video of the Election Commission officials inspecting the bags inside his helicopter, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the BJP believes in fair elections and follows all rules made by the poll body.

'Canadians go back to Europe', Khalistani supporter shouts in procession video A new video shows a Khalistani supporter in Canada calling Canadians to 'go back to Europe', and claiming 'we are the owners of Canada'.

PM Modi's aircraft suffers technical snag at Jharkhand's Deoghar airportThe incident took place after Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his events in the poll-bound Jharkhad and arrived at the Deoghar airport to return to Delhi.

Sanju Samson's lost years: Did Dhoni, Kohli, Rohit and Dravid play a part?Sanju Samson's father, Vishwanath, made a bombshell allegation when he blamed MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Rahul Dravid for his son's inconsistent opportunities at the highest level. While Samson seems to be cementing his place in the T20I side in 2024, he had been in and out of the team for years. Who was responsible for the lost years of Samson's career?

Video: New Zealand MP breaks into traditional dance, rips up bill in parliamentMaori MP Hana-Rawhiti Maipi-Clarke stood and began a ringing haka – a rhythmic Maori chant of challenge – which swelled to a roar as first opposition lawmakers, and then spectators in the public gallery, joined in.

Railways gets pet friendlier: Book your dog's AC First class travel online nowThe 700-plus bookings since May show pet-owners are lapping it up. On the minister's table now: a demand to have 'dog boxes' in all trains

Ajit Pawar distances himself from 'batenge to katenge' slogan: Don't support itMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar distanced himself from the controversial 'batenge to katenge' slogan, stating he could not support such divisive rhetoric.

Canadian cop, part of Khalistani mob that attacked temple, gets clean chitCanadian police officer Harinder Sohi, who was part of the pro-Khalistani rally, has been given a clean chit by Peel Police. People from the mob attacked devotees at the Hindu Sabha Temple in Brampton. In several videos, Sohi is seen in plain clothes and with a Khalistani flag, but Peel Police said he was trying to disarm protesters.
'Best buddies' Trump and Biden enjoy ice cream, sing and dance in viral AI videoDonald Trump and Joe Biden's AI video has gone viral on social media with close to 12 million views so far.

Shraddha Walker murder accused on Lawrence Bishnoi gang's hit list: SourcesAftab Poonawala, accused of killing Shraddha Walkar, is reportedly targeted by the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, as per Mumbai Police sources.

Indian students protest at Oxford University over Kashmir-debate panellistsIndian students in the UK protested outside the Oxford Union Society building and expressed their disapproval of a debate focusing on the status of Kashmir. The Indian students objected to the choice of panellists, because some had engaged in hate speech and were probed for terror links.

Freedom at Midnight review: Powerful portrayal of partitionReleased-Fri Nov 15, 2024Freedom at Midnight review: The Nikkhil Advani show has a light, easygoing way of telling the story, weaving together different threads that build up quietly. The dialogues and performances strike emotional chords effectively.

Kanguva makers take corrective measures after criticism for 'loud' musicProducer KE Gnanavel Raja said in a media interaction that they have taken the audience's feedback about the loud music in Kanguva, and the team is already working on fixing it.

Nimrat Kaur celebrates Guru Nanak Jayanti, distributes prasad to paparazziNimrat Kaur was clicked at a Mumbai Gurudwara as she arrived to seek blessings on the occasion of Guru Nanak Jayanti. The actor distributed prasad to paparazzi.

Mr Plankton review: Bittersweet romance weighed down by repetitivenessReleased-Fri Nov 08, 2024Netflix's latest K-drama offering, Mr Plankton, explores themes of love, regret, and family. Featuring an interesting star cast, the show released on November 8.

HAPPY review: BTS' Jin's solo debut is a deeply reflective album on life, happinessBTS Jin, also known as Kim Seokjin, has unveiled his debut solo album titled HAPPY. The album's title track, Running Wild, is accompanied by a heartfelt music video, marking a new chapter in Jin's musical journey.

sports.headline: Ruud van Nistelrooy sends farewell message to Manchester United after exitRuud van Nistelrooy sent a special farewell message to Manchester United and its supporters after his exit from the club. Van Nistelrooy served as United's interim manager for 4 matches.

BGT: Virat Kohli fails, Yashasvi Jaiswal stars in simulation practice in PerthStar India batter Virat Kohli was dismissed cheaply during team India's match simulation practice in Perth ahead of the first Test.

Mohammed Shami scores quickfire 36 after 4-wicket haul in Ranji TrophyMohammed Shami shone with the bat as well as ball in the Ranji Trophy match between Bengal and Madhya Pradesh in Indore. He contributed with a quick-fire 36 for Bengal on day 3 of the Test.

ICC cancels Champions Trophy tour in POK day after Pakistan's announcementThe International Cricket Council (ICC) has cancelled the planned trophy tour of the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in Skardu, Murree, and Muzaffarabad, areas which fall within Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). The decision came shortly after the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) announced the inclusion of these cities in the tour itinerary, which drew immediate objections from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI).

Fraser-McGurk's spot is in jeopardy after a poor performance against Pakistan in the ODI series.

Former World No.1 pair Rohan Bopanna, Matthew Ebden to split after ATP FinalsFormer World No.1 pair Rohan Bopanna and Matthew Ebden are all set to end their association after the ATP Tour finals in Turin. The duo will play their final group game on November 15, Friday.

BGT Recap: When Virat Kohli's inspired run was triggered by a Johnson bouncerVirat Kohli was treated with a vicious bouncer from Mitchell Johnson to start his Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2014-15. Kohli was woken up by the delivery and went on to score twin hundreds in Adelaide and almost got India the win.

Afghanistan Women's XI to play in Melbourne ahead of Ashes TestAustralian Cricket has come together to help fulfil the ambition of the members of the Afghanistan Women's cricket team now resident in Australia to play together.

OTD 1989: 15-year-old Sachin Tendulkar makes his international debut vs PakistanOn 15th November 1989, legendary India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar made his debut in international cricket against Pakistan in Karachi and showed glimpses of his greatness to the entire world.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
